author: Jason Cohen, Daily Caller News Foundation
title: Mark Halperin Says Cackling Kamala's Terrible CNN Town Hall Performance Was the "Last Straw for a Lot of Democrats" - ๐ The Liberty Daily
text: ( DCNF )โJournalist Mark Halperin said Thursday that Vice President Kamala Harrisโ โperformanceโ during her Wednesday CNN town hall left many Democrats feeling resigned about her candidacy. Harris faced criticism for her indirect answers during the event from CNN host Dana Bash and CNN senior political commentator David Axelrod shortly following the town hall . Halperin , on his 2WAY platform , asserted Democrats now realize Harris wonโt have the chance to sharpen her skills, with the presidential campaign nearing its end. Trending: All Recombinant โVaccinesโ and Adjuvants โ Not Just Covid-19 Jabs โ Are Now Implicated in DNA Contamination Scandal WATCH: โWeโre not going to go overboard here and say, โItโs over, [former President Donald] Trumpโs going to win.โ But a lot of what weโre going to talk about today is not great for Kamala Harris. Again, it doesnโt mean Trumpโs a great guy in the eyes of all of America,โ Halperin said. โIt doesnโt mean Trumpโs going to win, but where we are right now is there are increasing problems for the Democratic Party. You saw it in the punditry from Democrats last night on CNN after the town hall.โ โYou saw it on morning television, where Democratic pundits, trying to be poker-faced, are clearly feeling what a lot of Democratic donors are feeling and Democratic elected officials are feeling, which is thereโs no time left for her to get better,โ he added. โAnd I think the biggest story of the news cycle is, along with โTrump loves Hitler,โ which weโll talk about, is her performance last night was the last straw for a lot of Democrats. No more โthe more she does it, the better sheโll get.โโ The journalist then prompted Democratic strategist Dan Turrentine to share his perception of the town hall โand why itโs considered in Democratic circles to be such a disaster.โ Turrentine started by asserting Harris effectively advanced her messaging accusing Trump of being โa fascistโ before expressing concern about how the vice president performed. โWe saw this in 2019, and there was a hope that as she did more interviews and settled down and got more comfortable, that you would see kind of a human being with some passion, some humor. Because we talk about it โ Trump is having fun. Like it is clear as day that heโs feeling pretty good,โ he said. โSo I think the frustrating part to Democrats is it is clear that she is just not really capable right now of answering that question: โWhy should I be for you?โ And I hope that enough voters decide that she doesnโt have to, but I donโt feel confident about that.โ Harris currently trails Trump in all of the seven top swing states, according to the RealClear Polling averages. Halperin asserted Tuesday that Trump will be president-elect on Nov. 5 if the current early voting trajectory persists.

author: Stefan Junge
title: Angela Tait
text:
Angela Tait, the visionary behind
Tait Consulting, is a transformative force in HR and recruitment. Her mission is to empower leaders, enabling them to reclaim their time and build their empire. Angela achieves this by helping them hire top talent, implementing strategic initiatives, and providing one-on-one business coaching to boost profitability.
Armed with a Masterโs in Organizational Development from Pepperdine University and a Society of Human Resource Management-Certified Professional certification (SHRM-CP), Angela brings a potent blend of education and real-world experience to her role as an HR expert. She also serves on the board of the Arizona Organization Development Network (AZODN), further solidifying her standing in the field.
Amidst the challenges of a pandemic, Angela achieved a remarkable feat by spearheading the growth of a real estate company from 10 to 100 employees in just two years, elevating retention rates by an impressive 80%.
Angelaโs expertise has earned her recognition in esteemed publications like USNews, Authority Magazine, Buffalo News, and more. She lives in Phoenix, AZ, where she balances her thriving career with her cherished role as a wife and mother of two children.
What is your typical day, and how do you make it productive?
My typical day is quite dynamic, but Iโve developed a routine that helps me stay productive and balanced. I kickstart my morning with a quick Peloton workout, ensuring Iโm physically energized for the day ahead. Spending precious moments with my two boys in the morning is essential; it sets a positive tone for the day. My older son heads to pre-k, and the nanny takes care of my youngest, Oliver, giving me dedicated work time.
I have a cozy office in my house, separate from the main living area, which allows me to maintain focus. In the morning, I dive into my inbox, attend to emails, and engage in writing tasks, which might include articles, social media posts, or progress on my upcoming book due by the end of 2023. I also manage meetings and follow up with potential candidates for open positions, all while advancing ongoing projects and addressing business development needs.
In the afternoon, I switch gears to pick up my son from school and cherish quality time with both my boys. The key to my productivity lies in a balanced approach: moving my body, actively pursuing my goals, and, most importantly, keeping my family, which is my top value, at the forefront of my daily priorities. This harmonious blend fuels my productivity and fulfillment throughout the day.
How do you bring ideas to life?
Bringing ideas to life involves a combination of collaboration and swift action. Hereโs a breakdown of my process:
1. Conceptualization: Start by brainstorming and generating ideas. This can be done individually or through collaboration with others. Group discussions often lead to a wider range of perspectives and creative solutions.
2. Evaluation: Assess the feasibility and potential impact of each idea. Consider factors like resources required, time constraints, and alignment with goals or objectives.
3. Planning: Once a viable idea is selected, create a detailed plan outlining the steps needed to execute it. Define roles and responsibilities if working with a team.
4. Action: Donโt delay. Begin implementing my idea as soon as possible. Procrastination can lead to missed opportunities or diminished enthusiasm.
5. Adaptation: Be open to adjusting the plan as I progress. Not every detail can be anticipated, and flexibility is key to overcoming unexpected challenges.
6. Feedback: Continuously seek feedback from stakeholders, team members, or potential users. Their input can help refine the idea and make it even better.
7. Persistence: The process of bringing an idea to life can be challenging. Staying committed, remain resilient in the face of setbacks, and keep refining and iterating as necessary.
8. Celebration: When the idea reaches fruition, take a moment to celebrate success and acknowledge the efforts of those involved.
By combining collaboration with a bias toward action and adaptability, I can effectively bring ideas to life and turn them into tangible achievements.
Whatโs one trend that excites you?
The trend of companies prioritizing employee well-being and development is indeed exciting. Itโs a shift towards a more human-centric approach to work, and it has the potential to create a positive ripple effect not only within organizations, but also in society as a whole. When employees are happier, more engaged, and supported in their growth, they are likely to be more productive, creative, and innovative. This, in turn, can lead to more sustainable businesses and a better quality of life for individuals. Itโs a trend that aligns with the idea that when people thrive at work, they contribute to a happier and more fulfilled world beyond the workplace, and thatโs truly inspiring.
What is one habit that helps you be productive?
One habit that helps me be productive is setting clear and prioritized daily goals. Each morning, I identify the most important tasks I need to accomplish and create a to-do list with a clear order of priority. This habit helps me stay focused and organized throughout the day, ensuring that I tackle the most critical tasks first and maintain a sense of accomplishment as I check them off my list.
What advice would you give your younger self?
The advice to trust the process and have faith in the journey is valuable. Hereโs a message to my younger self:
Dear Younger Self,
Trust the process of life. There will be moments of uncertainty and challenges that may seem insurmountable, but remember that everything happens for a reason. The struggles and successes, the highs and lows โ they all play a part in shaping who you become. Have faith that the path youโre on will lead to valuable lessons and opportunities for growth. Even when things donโt make sense at the moment, they will eventually fall into place. Embrace each experience as a stepping stone toward a brighter future.
With patience and perseverance, youโll find your way. Keep believing in yourself, keep learning, and keep moving forward. The journey is as important as the destination, and it will all be worth it.
Sincerely, Your Wiser Self
Tell us something you believe almost nobody agrees with you.
While the idea of waking up early is often associated with productivity, I believe that the optimal wake-up time can vary from person to person. Some individuals are naturally more productive during later hours, and itโs essential to align your schedule with your circadian rhythms and personal preferences. Itโs not always necessary to wake up super early to be productive. The key is to find a routine that works best for you and allows you to maximize your productivity and overall well-being.
The habit of embracing discomfort and taking risks. Stepping outside your comfort zone is where personal growth and learning often occur. I recommend that everyone should make a conscious effort to get uncomfortable regularly. Challenge yourself, take risks, and put yourself in situations where you might face rejection or failure. Itโs in these moments of discomfort that you discover your true potential, build resilience, and learn valuable lessons. Embracing discomfort is a powerful catalyst for personal growth and can lead to meaningful and transformative experiences.
When you feel overwhelmed or unfocused, what do you do?
When I find myself overwhelmed or struggling to focus, I turn to physical activity. Whether itโs a workout, dancing, or simply taking a walk, moving my body helps me reset and re-energize. It clears my mind, reduces stress, and allows me to return to my tasks with a renewed sense of focus and clarity. Physical activity is my go-to method for regaining balance and productivity when things get overwhelming.
One of the most impactful strategies that has propelled my career and business growth is prioritizing relationships. Iโve found that cultivating meaningful connections with others, both personally and professionally, can open doors and create opportunities that might not have been possible otherwise. I actively engage with my network by consistently sharing my business endeavors on social media platforms. This not only keeps my network informed about my work, but also encourages referrals and recommendations. In fact, the majority of my clients have come through referrals from friends, family, and connections within my network. By building and maintaining strong relationships, Iโve not only gained valuable clients, I have also established a reputation as someone trustworthy and reliable in my field. This strategy has driven business growth and enriched my career with a network of supportive individuals who continue to contribute to my success.
A failure in my career has been underestimating my capability and my worth in previous roles that I took or turned down. One example is making a decision to give a role to someone less qualified due to personal reasons, resulting in taking a step down from a position I had worked hard to earn. From these experiences, I learned the importance of pausing, reflecting, and taking the time to carefully consider my decisions.
I realized that quick, impulsive responses based on short-term benefits can sometimes lead to long-term setbacks. It taught me the value of a more deliberate and proactive approach to decision-making. I now prioritize looking at the long-term rewards and considering the impact of my choices on my career and personal goals. These failures served as valuable lessons in making decisions that align with my desired outcomes and contribute to my future success.
What is one business idea youโre willing to give away to our readers?
If youโre seeking cost-effective support for your business, consider utilizing Handshake to find interns. Itโs a win-win situation where you can offload tasks and provide valuable experience to someone in your field. Handshake is a platform used by colleges nationwide to connect current and alumni students with open positions.
LinkedIn is a crucial software tool for me. I use it for networking in my business and also to identify potential candidates for roles Iโm recruiting for clients.
What is the best $100 you recently spent?
I invested in a ticket to attend The Powerhouse Women event in Scottsdale, AZ. It provided valuable information, motivation in my business goals, reconnections with friends, and new connections with inspiring women in business, leading to valuable resources.
Iโve gained significant value from โThe Learning Leader Showโ with Ryan Hawk due to its insightful and brilliant guest speakers. Additionally, โBuy Back Your Timeโ by Dan Martell has equipped me with valuable tools to scale my business and reclaim more time in my day.
Whatโs a movie or series you recently enjoyed and why?
The recent movie, โBarbieโ was enjoyable because it addresses womenโs challenges and empowerment in a thoughtful way. Films that explore these themes can be not only entertaining, but also thought-provoking and inspiring. It encouraged important conversations and reflection on gender equality and feminism in society today.
Key learnings:
โ Prioritizing relationships, both personal and professional, is a crucial driver of career and business success.
โ Embracing discomfort and taking calculated risks fosters personal growth and development.
โ Effective decision-making involves pausing, reflecting, and considering the long-term consequences of choices.
โ Utilizing online platforms like Handshake can provide cost-effective support for businesses through internships.
โ Engaging in physical activity, such as exercise or dancing, is an effective strategy to reset and regain focus when feeling overwhelmed or unfocused.

author: Ruetir
title: Opinion - Deborah Bizarria: When the vote becomes dogma: the consequences of instrumentalizing faith
text:
Recent data from Atlas Intel to CNN Brazil reveal that only 18% of Brazilians trust evangelical churches today, while 73% do not deposit credit in them. This decline in trust is not the result of chance; It directly reflects the actions and omissions of the leaders and members of these churches, which often transformed faith into an instrument of material power and prosperity, to the detriment of the central values โโof the Gospel.
Since 2018, CNT/MDA has already pointed to a retraction in the credibility of the Church โ in line with both Catholics and Protestants. That year, 40.1% of respondents considered the most reliable institution in the country. This number fell to 34.3% in 2019 and parked by 25.8% in 2020, showing a clear and persistent negative trend.
In many congregations, the pulpit, which should be a space for reception and spiritual orientation, has become an extension of the electoral stage. In 2022, several pastors not only endorsed candidates, but even conditioned the faith on the vote, imposing political alignment as a religious requirement. Anyone who did not follow this guidance was seen as โspiritual deserterโ, generating internal divisions and driving people away.
In addition to politicization, scandals involving religious leaders further corrode the credibility of the institutions. The dissemination of irregular practices, deviations of resources and internal conflicts amplify the feeling that moral coherence was in the background.
The religious influence on political behavior depends on the credibility of leaders and the quality of messages within congregations, according to researchers Paul Djupe and Jacob Neheisel. When faith is instrumentalized for political or financial purposes, this influence delegitimates, and the removal of members or supporters becomes inevitable.
It is important to recognize that many communities will continue to choose politicians in exchange for power, without any improvement in the quality of life of their supporters or surroundings. Each believerโs commitment must be, above all, with God and with the people under his care, not with the defense of the reputation of the โevangelicals.โ Throughout the history of humanity, inside and outside Christianity, it was very badly committed in the name of some deity.
However, it is expected that there will be reflection in the media where change is possible. The recovery of confidence requires humility to recognize errors and willingness to change. Faith cannot be used as a currency of exchange, whether by political power, financial or emotional blessing. If some communities want to play a community reference role, they need to put God at the center of their mission.
Revising failures is the first step to overcome them. Recognizing that the electoral use of the altar was a moral error, it will be possible to work for a sincere approach with the community, rescuing fundamental values โโsuch as honesty, solidarity and service. This is where churches can meet the path of public respect.
However, this does not mean that there is no room for people who โ but other things โ are religious in public life. It means that it is necessary to define an agenda that prioritizes not only the common good but what the Bible calls on: take care of the poor, the orphan, the widow, and the foreigner. Above particular interests or specific groups, even from other evangelicals.

author: Gabriela Gomez-Misserian
title: The Little West Virginia Farm with Big Dreams โ Garden & Gun
text: Driving through the rolling, densely forested mountains of West Virginia and into the valley where Wardensville (population 379) lies, itโs surprisingly tough not to stop. Maybe the life-sized red cow-with-a-cowboy-hat sculpture at the [Lost River Trading Post](https://www.lostrivertradingpost.com/) catches your eye. Or those umbrella-topped picnic tables near the [Wardensville Garden Market](https://farmsworkwonders.org/wardensville-garden-market/) beckon. Or you might have heard about [Mackโs Bingo Kitchen](https://farmsworkwonders.org/macks-bingo-kitchen/) and its crispy, juicy chicken sandwich. Since 2016, this Appalachian town has been revivified by a nonprofit called Farms Work Wonders (FWW). The market and restaurant aboveโplus [Lewis Farm](https://farmsworkwonders.org/lewis-farm/), Mackโs Bingo Bakery, and [Dakota Glass Works](https://farmsworkwonders.org/dakota-glass-works/)โfall under the expanding FWW canopy, which aims to grow everything from veggies to the areaโs economy. The groupโs primary focus, though, is supporting local youth. In 2013, it started small when Washington insiders Paul Yandura and his partner, Don Hitchcock, โretiredโ from D.C. to rural West Virginia. They got real estate licenses and bought their own first listing, envisioning it as a community hub and trading post. The fact that 10,000 cars and trucks pass through Wardensville daily meant likely foot traffic. (The town is near the busy intersection of I-81 and I-66 in nearby Virginia.) Around the area, Yandura had often heard this sobering refrain: โYoung people want to leave; thereโs nothing for them to do. We canโt do anything. Weโve tried.โ But Yanduraโwhoโd run a consulting firm and had major community organizing experience (he helped the 1994 White House form a gay-and-lesbian outreach office)โ appreciated a challenge. Friend and philanthropist Jonathan D. Lewis visited them, offered the support of his foundation (now called the Jonathan D + Mark C. Lewis Foundation), and encouraged โtaking a risk.โ The Foundation, which Yandura is the CEO of, took on FWW as a pilot project. In 2016, FWW started with a farm and outdoor stand that employed five local adults and five youth. Initially, they sold potatoes, beets, okra, and herbs at a roadside stand. They didnโt have to teach the fundamentals of farming in Appalachia, but the organization emphasized organic and regenerative practices like crop rotation, minimal tillage, and using multiple-season extension structures to help its three quarters of an acre produce year-round. This year, Lewis Farm will grow some seventy-five varieties of food and flowers, including chef favorites such as ginger, turmeric, and specialty peppers. Since its early days, FWW has added the bakery (known for luscious cinnamon rolls), a glass-blowing shop, and, last summer, an inviting restaurant that serves up such specialties as pimento cheese with fried hot peppers, grilled whole trout with roasted squash, and soup beans with farm greens. The group now employs ninety-nine staffers, and this summer, up to fifteen recruited youth ages sixteen to twenty-one will start in the six-week challenge program that develops their workforce and social skills before theyโre offered positions as junior crew members at one of FWWโs businesses. That program is followed by a six-month immersion into these โliving classrooms.โ โThe number one thing that highlights this place is that everyone around you really cares,โ says Brenden Furlong, nineteen, a part-time market staffer who studies at the local community college and plans to attend West Virginia University. โIt really matters to them that youโre successful.โ Youth can tailor the program to their goals, and FWWโs โmission teamโ of advisors is there as needed. Some youth later transition to staff positions. Now a full-time restaurant employee at Mackโs Bingo Kitchen, Elvira Camarillo has honed her knife techniques and solidified her desire to be a chef. Former junior crew member and current restaurant cook Kollin Quarles finds FWWโs emphasis on communication skills especially helpful. โThe managers have an open ear for anything,โ he says. โAs a coworker and on a personal level, you have somebody to trust and talk to.โ The work hasnโt been without its hurdles. โAs with most places in West Virginia,โ Furlong says, โa lot of the time they donโt like outsiders too much, to be perfectly honest.โ Yandura understands why. โIn Appalachia,โ he says, โmany times people came in and extracted resources and made a lot of money, whether it was on the beauty or the nature or coal.โ But Yandura and Hitchcock are walking the walkโthey literally live just off the main road. And what a thriving Main Street itโs become.

author: NA
title: Football: Soccer-Late rally fails to save Tottenham in 4-2 loss at Brighton | The Star
text:
BRIGHTON, England (Reuters) - Tottenham Hotspur's top-four ambitions suffered a blow as they lost 4-2 at Brighton & Hove Albion in the Premier League on Thursday with only a late rally saving them from their heaviest defeat since Ange Postecoglou became manager.
Victory would have put injury-hit Spurs above Manchester City into fourth spot but they were mauled on the south coast as a Brighton side also missing key players ran riot.
A powerful early strike by Josh Hinshelwood and Joao Pedro's penalty gave the hosts a deserved 2-0 lead at halftime as Tottenham struggled to deal with Brighton's intensity.
The visitors responded in the second half with Richarlison having a goal disallowed but when halftime substitute Pervis Estupinan sent a thunderbolt past Spurs keeper Guglielmo Vicario and Joao Pedro netted a second penalty the game seemed over.
However, when Tottenham's late substitute Alejo Veliz fired home from close range in the 75th minute and Ben Davies scored with a header a miraculous comeback suddenly looked possible.
Midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg hit the post for Spurs in stoppage time as Brighton looked nervy but they held on to move into eighth place in the table on 30 points while Tottenham remain fifth on 36, a point behind Manchester City in fourth.
(Reporting by Martyn Herman; Editing by Ken Ferris)

author: Andre da Silva Costa
title: Exames detectam lesรฃo de grau 2 na coxa direita, e Raniele vira desfalque no Corinthians
text:
Corinthiansganhou um novo desfalque para a sequรชncia da temporada. O volante Raniele foi submetido a exames mรฉdicos nesta quinta-feira e teve detectada uma lesรฃo de grau 2 no bรญceps femoral da coxa direita.
A informaรงรฃo foi confirmada pelo prรณprio clube, que nรฃo divulgou o prazo de recuperaรงรฃo. A tendรชncia, no entanto, รฉ que ele se ausente dos gramados por cerca de um mรชs. O jogador darรก inรญcio ร recuperaรงรฃo com os fisioterapeutas do Timรฃo nesta sexta-feira.
O meio-campista Raniele sofreu uma lesรฃo de grau dois no bรญceps femoral da coxa direita.
Nesta sexta-feira (21), o camisa 14 iniciarรก a recuperaรงรฃo com a equipe de fisioterapia.
๐ธ Rodrigo Coca / Corinthians[#VaiCorinthians][pic.twitter.com/sf2x0efVKD]
โ Corinthians (@Corinthians)[February 20, 2025]
O meio-campista
se contundiu ainda no primeiro tempo do jogo contra a Universidad Central, nesta quarta-feira, em Caracas, pela ida da segunda fase da Libertadores. Ele levou a mรฃo ร coxa direita aos 18 minutos e foi substituรญdo por Breno Bidon. O camisa 14 deixou o gramado chorando.
O diagnรณstico da lesรฃo foi obtido pelo Corinthians nesta quinta, no retorno da equipe ร Venezuela. Raniele perderรก a partida de volta contra a UCV e tambรฉm deve ficar de fora das quartas de final do Campeonato Paulista, alรฉm de uma eventual semifinal.
O volante vinha sendo titular do time do Parque Sรฃo Jorge nesta temporada. Em 2025, ele soma oito partidas com a camisa alvinegra. Jรก em toda sua passagem pelo clube, sรฃo 65 compromissos.
Em sua ausรชncia, a tendรชncia รฉ que Josรฉ Martรญnez seja recuado e exerรงa o papel de primeiro volante. Outras opรงรตes para o setor sรฃo Ryan e Alex Santana.

author: Pablo Romero
title: Mayra Ramรญrez, expulsada en la derrota de Colombia contra Francia en los Juegos Olรญmpicos por esta dura falta: video
text: La Selecciรณn Colombia debutรณ con derrota en el torneo femenino de fรบtbol de los Juegos Olรญmpicos de Parรญs 2024, al caer 3.2 contra la local Francia. (Le puede interesar: Presidente Ramรณn Jesurรบn suma otro problema tras ser detenido en Estados Unidos: congresista enviรณ carta a la Fiscalรญa exigiendo una rendiciรณn de cuentas por escรกndalo) Colombia tuvo un pรฉsimo primer tiempo en el que recibiรณ tres goles. En la segunda parte logro acercarse al empate, con los goles de Catalina Usme y Manuela Pavi. Sin embargo, el juego del equipo estuvo lejos de su nivel habitual y esta derrota lo deja mal parado en el grupo. Para colmo, Colombia perdiรณ a una de sus figuras, la delantera del Chelsea, Mayra Ramรญrez. Mayra, que lucho mucho en todo el partido para buscar su gol, terminรณ viendo la tarjeta roja al minuto 86. La delantera pisรณ en el tobillo a una rival y la jueza del partido, tras revisiรณn, decidiรณ sacarle la tarjeta roja directa. DEPORTES

author: Juan Infante
title: Temporal en Tucumรกn: reportan cortes de luz, calles anegadas y รกrboles caรญdos
text:
El Servicio Meteorolรณgico Nacional habรญa puesto a Tucumรกn bajo alerta naranja por tormentas fuertes desde la medianoche a la maรฑana del viernes.
โEl รกrea serรก afectada por lluvias y tormentas, algunas localmente fuertes o severas. Las mismas estarรกn acompaรฑadas por abundante caรญda de agua, actividad elรฉctrica intensa, caรญda de granizo de diversos tamaรฑos y rรกfagas fuertes. Se prevรฉn valores de precipitaciรณn acumulada entre 40 y 70 mm, pudiendo ser superados en forma puntualโ, reza el informe.
Agregรณ que las condiciones del tiempo mejorarรกn despuรฉs del mediodรญa del viernes y que las temperaturas descenderรกn un poco el viernes, para el sรกbado empezar a subir nuevamente.
La tormenta que se anunciรณ ayer llegรณ esta madrugada a Tucumรกn. Poco despues de las 05:00 y tras impactantes rรกfagas de viento, las precipitaciones comenzaron en la zona de Capital y alrededores.
Usuarios de diferentes barrios del Gran San Miguel de Tucumรกn y tambiรฉn del interior provincial reportan cortes de luz, calles anegadas y varios รกrboles caรญdos.
Caso Cecilia Strzyzowski: autorizaron al Clan Sena a poder reunirse
La Empresa de Distribuciรณn Elรฉctrica de Tucumรกn (EDET) informรณ que el intenso temporal registrado en la madrugada de este viernes dejรณ a millas de usuarios sin suministro elรฉctrico en varias zonas de la provincia.
Las รกreas mรกs afectadas son el centro, sur y este de Tucumรกn, incluyendo localidades como el Gran San Miguel de Tucumรกn, Simoca, Chicligasta, Monteros y Lules.
Segรบn el comunicado de EDET, los cortes se deben a la caรญda de รกrboles, ramas y descargas atmosfรฉricas que daรฑaron las lรญneas elรฉctricas.
Las cuadrillas de la empresa trabajan intensamente para restablecer el servicio, priorizando las zonas mรกs crรญticas.
Sin embargo, no se precisรณ un tiempo estimado para la normalizaciรณn completa. Solicitan a los usuarios mantenerse informados a travรฉs de los canales oficiales y tomar precauciones ante posibles interrupciones prolongadas.
